https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/deployment.html#using-an-alternate-port
Clearly states what to do ir order to use an alternate port, but what happens whit the older messages?
I mean, we have this excelente zulip server 6.2 since 2019.
What about the history?
This topic was moved here from #issues > Using an alternate port in an existing server by Tim Abbott.
@Cesar Celis I don't understand the question -- why do you expect switching the server to an alternate port would break older messages?

Tim Abbott said:

Cesar Celis I don't understand the question -- why do you expect switching the server to an alternate port would break older messages?

Because, we have an existing server with history messages and maybe i need to change the default port to 7443. What about the reference to older messages?
Sorry, english it's not my native tongue.

@Cesar Celis generally most references to other messages in Zulip are done using relative links; those will keep working. External links to your Zulip server won't work unless you 're able to set up a redirect or something, but that's not under our control.

For example, #**production help>Using an alternate port in an existing server** generates #production help > Using an alternate port in an existing server, and the actual link in the message has href="/#narrow/stream/31-production-help/topic/Using.20an.20alternate.20port.20in.20an.20existing.20server", which will keep working even if the URL for the Zulip server changes.
Cesar Celis has marked this topic as resolved.
